meanings.definition: A condition in which an abnormal accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid in the brain causes enlargement of the skull and compression of the brain.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that hydrocephalus is when too much fluid builds up in the brain.
meanings.sent2: The baby's hydrocephalus required surgery to relieve the pressure on the brain.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character had a funny case of hydrocephalus, making his head comically large.
meanings.sent4: Her worries felt like a heavy hydrocephalus pressing down on her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The image of a balloon slowly filling with water helped her understand hydrocephalus better.

meanings.definition: The abnormal accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid in the brain.
meanings.sent1: The MRI showed signs of hydrocephalus in the patient's brain.
meanings.sent2: The neurologist specializes in treating cases of hydrocephalus.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing bathtub was like a small hydrocephalus in the bathroom.
meanings.sent4: His excitement bubbled up like a sudden hydrocephalus of joy.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time seemed distorted, like a slow-motion hydrocephalus of moments.
